code: @Manual{,   title = {EvoNN: Phylogenetic Tree Parameter Estimation by Neural Networks},   author = {Tianjian Qin},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://evolandeco.github.io/EvoNN/}, }

title: Phylogenetic Tree Parameter Estimation by Neural Networks
text: package illustrates integrate R pre-trained neural network models phylogenetic tree parameter estimation. R interface provided package, although utilized R Python. Step 1: Install R Python latest versions R Python installed correctly. recommended alter default settings installers. Click open R official website Click open Python official website latest versions Rtools pip also required. Rtools can installed manually website, pip usually bundled Python installation. Step 2: Install R packages

title: Phylogenetic Tree Parameter Estimation by Neural Networks
text: Step 1: Prepare phylogeny Click download example phylogeny Valente et al 2020 Nature, unzip favorite path. Step 2: Estimate parameters step may take prepare virtual environment first time function run. Wait completion message. Step 3: Bootstrap uncertainty execution time depends estimated parameters, parameter settings may take long fail consistently. recommended set timeout limit, bootstrap iterations exceed limit return NAs. Step 4: Plot uncertainty neural network estimates indicated red dashed lines blue values. uncertainties represented density curves bootstrap results.
code: library(EvoNN) # Set the path to the tree file path <- "your_path/Columbiformes.tre" # Read in tree file if it is in Newick format, e.g. the example phylogeny test_tre <- ape::read.tree(path) # Otherwise, use the following to read in Nexus format # test_tre <- ape::read.nexus(path) result <- nn_estimate(test_tre, scenario = "DDD") bootstrap <- nn_bootstrap_uncertainty(result, n = 100, timeout = 30) nn_plot_bootstrap(bootstrap, result, scenario = "DDD")

title: Phylogenetic Tree Parameter Estimation by Neural Networks
text: Error messages relating numpy version installation appear run parameter_estimation function first time. issue might newly installed Python libraries loaded. simple solution: fully close IDE (e.g. R Studio, VS Code DataSpell, software use R coding), open . Re-run example code, work time. Mac users might install cmake build dependencies source code. Run install brew install --cask cmake terminal install .

title: Phylogenetic Tree Parameter Estimation by Neural Networks
text: parameter_estimation() function automatically set Python virtual environment named “EvoNN” home directory first run, may take . can manually remove virtual environment running following code R:

what: Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
title: Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
text: Simulating diversity-dependent diversification process

title: Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
text: pars Vector parameters: pars[1] corresponds lambda (speciation rate) pars[2] corresponds mu (extinction rate) pars[3] corresponds K (clade-level carrying capacity) age Sets crown age simulation ddmodel Sets model diversity-dependence: ddmodel == 1 : linear dependence speciation rate parameter K (= diversity speciation = extinction)ddmodel == 1.3 : linear dependence speciation rate parameter K' (= diversity speciation = 0)ddmodel == 2 : exponential dependence speciation rate parameter K (= diversity speciation = extinction)ddmodel == 2.1 : variant exponential dependence speciation rate offset infinityddmodel == 2.2 : 1/n dependence speciation rateddmodel == 2.3 : exponential dependence speciation rate parameter x (= exponent)ddmodel == 3 : linear dependence extinction rate ddmodel == 4 : exponential dependence extinction rate ddmodel == 4.1 : variant exponential dependence extinction rate offset infinity ddmodel == 4.2 : 1/n dependence extinction rate offset infinity ddmodel == 5 : linear dependence speciation extinction rate

title: Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
text: list following four elements: first element tree extant species phylo format  second element tree species, including extinct species, phylo format  third element matrix species  - first column time species born  - second column label parent species; positive negative values indicate whether species belongs left right crown lineage  - third column label daughter species ; positive negative values indicate whether species belongs left right crown lineage  - fourth column time extinction species. equals -1, species still extant. fourth element set branching times tree extant species.

title: Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
text: Etienne, R.S. et al. 2012, Proc. Roy. Soc. B 279: 1300-1309, doi: 10.1098/rspb.2011.1439  - Etienne, R.S. & B. Haegeman 2012. . Nat. 180: E75-E89, doi: 10.1086/667574

title: Function to simulate the diversity-dependent diversification process — dd_sim
text: Rampal S. Etienne

title: Function to bootstrap the uncertainty of the EvoNN estimates — nn_bootstrap_uncertainty
Function to bootstrap the uncertainty of the EvoNN estimates — nn_bootstrap_uncertainty
text: estimate EvoNN estimate speciation rate, extinction rate, carrying capacity (DDD) scenario diversification scenario: "BD" : Birth-death diversification "DDD" : Diversity-dependent diversification n number bootstrap iterations timeout maximum time seconds iteration

title: Function to bootstrap the uncertainty of the EvoNN estimates — nn_bootstrap_uncertainty
text: results_NN data frame following columns: lambda : Speciation rate mu : Extinction rate cap : Carrying capacity (DDD)

text: tree phylogenetic tree phylo format scenario diversification scenario: "BD" : Birth-death diversification "DDD" : Diversity-dependent diversification

title: Function to estimate phylogenetic parameters using EvoNN — nn_estimate
text: list following elements:  pred_lambda  : Speciation rate  pred_mu  : Extinction rate  pred_cap  : Carrying capacity (DDD)  scale  : factor scale tree desired age (10)  num_nodes  : Number nodes tree

title: Function to estimate phylogenetic parameters using EvoNN — nn_estimate
